ui

Class FPSCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.FPSCounter

  • public class FPSCounter
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple class which uses the TextRenderer to provide an FPS counter overlaid on top of the scene.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int LOWER_LEFT 
      static int LOWER_RIGHT 
      static int UPPER_LEFT 
      static int UPPER_RIGHT

      Creates a new FPSCounter with the given font.
      FPSCounter(javax.media.opengl.GLDrawable drawable, java.awt.Font font, boolean antialiased, boolean useFractionalMetrics)
      Creates a new FPSCounter with the given font and rendering attributes.
      FPSCounter(javax.media.opengl.GLDrawable drawable, int textSize)
      Creates a new FPSCounter with the given font size.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getFPS()
      Get the lattest FPS value.
      int getTextLocation()
      Gets the relative location where the text of this FPSCounter will be drawn: one of UPPER_LEFT, UPPER_RIGHT, LOWER_LEFT, or LOWER_RIGHT.
      void render()
      Updates the FPSCounter's internal timer and counter and draws the computed FPS.

      Changes the current color of this TextRenderer to the supplied one, where each component ranges from 0.0f - 1.0f.
      void setTextLocation(int textLocation)
      Sets the relative location where the text of this FPSCounter will be drawn: one of UPPER_LEFT, UPPER_RIGHT, LOWER_LEFT, or LOWER_RIGHT.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FPSCounter

        public FPSCounter(javax.media.opengl.GLDrawable drawable,
          int textSize)
           throws javax.media.opengl.GLException
        Creates a new FPSCounter with the given font size. An OpenGL context must be current at the time the constructor is called.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the drawable to render the text to
        textSize - the point size of the font to use
        Throws:
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current when the constructor is called

      • FPSCounter

        public FPSCounter(javax.media.opengl.GLDrawable drawable,
          java.awt.Font font)
           throws javax.media.opengl.GLException
        Creates a new FPSCounter with the given font. An OpenGL context must be current at the time the constructor is called.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the drawable to render the text to
        font - the font to use
        Throws:
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current when the constructor is called

      • FPSCounter

        public FPSCounter(javax.media.opengl.GLDrawable drawable,
          java.awt.Font font,
          boolean antialiased,
          boolean useFractionalMetrics)
           throws javax.media.opengl.GLException
        Creates a new FPSCounter with the given font and rendering attributes. An OpenGL context must be current at the time the constructor is called.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the drawable to render the text to
        font - the font to use
        antialiased - whether to use antialiased fonts
        useFractionalMetrics - whether to use fractional font
        Throws:
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current when the constructor is called

    • Method Detail

      • getFPS

        public float getFPS()
        Get the lattest FPS value.
        Returns:
        the lattest FPS value.

      • getTextLocation

        public int getTextLocation()
        Gets the relative location where the text of this FPSCounter will be drawn: one of UPPER_LEFT, UPPER_RIGHT, LOWER_LEFT, or LOWER_RIGHT. Defaults to LOWER_RIGHT.

      • setTextLocation

        public void setTextLocation(int textLocation)
        Sets the relative location where the text of this FPSCounter will be drawn: one of UPPER_LEFT, UPPER_RIGHT, LOWER_LEFT, or LOWER_RIGHT. Defaults to LOWER_RIGHT.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(float r,
            float g,
            float b,
            float a)
              throws javax.media.opengl.GLException
        Changes the current color of this TextRenderer to the supplied one, where each component ranges from 0.0f - 1.0f. The alpha component, if used, does not need to be premultiplied into the color channels as described in the documentation for Texture, although premultiplied colors are used internally. The default color is opaque white.
        Parameters:
        r - the red component of the new color
        g - the green component of the new color
        b - the blue component of the new color
        a - the alpha component of the new color, 0.0f = completely transparent, 1.0f = completely opaque
        Throws:
        javax.media.opengl.GLException - If an OpenGL context is not current when this method is called

      • render

        public void render()
        Updates the FPSCounter's internal timer and counter and draws the computed FPS. It is assumed this method will be called only once per frame.
